member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

summary.para: Provides static methods that should be called from the constructors of licensed classes.
Also provides a static method that can be called to show the about box with product and licensing information.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: Check the ShouldNag property of the returned to determine whether the licensed class should nag the user. This value is set to true in situations where a valid license was not found but a nag dialog could not be displayed. In these cases, the licensed class is supposed to nag in some other way (with a watermark for example).

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
Whether the nag dialog should be displayed when a valid license is not found.
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: This overload was created for use in WPF. It should be called in the control's constructor in order to support license persistence correctly. But it should not show the nag dialog until the control is fully loaded, or the VS designer may remain blank.
So the solution is this:

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Nag(System.Type,C1.Util.Licensing.LicenseInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Nag user by showing AboutBox with license information. Show it only once per day per assembly.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
object that contains information about the license.
Whether we're running at design or run time.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Version of Validate used by constructors that take runtime keys.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Assembly that contains the owner licensed control.
member.returns: A with information about the runtime key.

remarks.para: This allows a licensed C1 class to create other C1 objects bypassing license verification for the child objects.
For extra safety, we check that the owner object is defined in an assembly the contains a 'C1ProductInfo' attribute.

where the runtime key will be stored.

member.remarks: Call this method from application-type products (that always require a license to be installed in the registry). In this case, the parameter should be set to null.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.SafeLicenseContext
member.summary:
Provides a version of GetSavedLicenseKey that doesn't require special permissions.
The code was mostly copied from the .NET framework, but then changed in a few places to require fewer permissions (assembly name, file io, etc).
The main change is the use of a custom deserializer to read Hashtable objects instead of the original BinaryFormatter, which requires permissions.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.C1AboutNameAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to specify the product name shown on the About Box.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.C1ProductInfoAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to attach licensing/product information to assemblies.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.ProductLicense
member.summary:
Represents a license for a product (e.g. C1BarCode, C1Studio Enterprise).
Provides methods for: - generating new license keys (administrative task) - checking license key validity (used by installer and products) - generating and checking runtime keys (used by products) - installing/uninstalling licenses (used by installer)
The install/uninstall code requires elevated permissions, and is used only by setups and utilities (not by controls). The code is implemented in the ProductLicense.Installer.cs, which controls should not include since it won't be useful to them.
When a product is sold, we send the user a license KEY. The user installs a license on his machine by providing his name, his company name, and the key.
The is a string in the following format:
AAQYYCC-XX-NNNNNN-DD-DZZZZZZ
Where:
AA: Product code (should match one of the products in the product catalog (see ProductInformation.GetProductCatalog()). Q: Quarter when the license key was issued (1, 2, or 3) YY: Year when the license key was issued (e.g., 10 for 2010) CC: Order code, two chars that indicate whether this is a new sale, upgrade, renewal, special offer, etc. XX: Hash code to ensure key validity. NNNNNN: Unique serial number. DDD: Vendor code, three chars ZZZZZZ: Combination of random numbers for uniqueness and extra hash.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.MappingCollectionBase`1.IdMapping
member.summary: Returns object for the property. If the storage object is bound to a data source via its DataSource property, the properties of this object allow the property to be bound to the appropriate field in the data source.
member.remarks: Each object derived from is identified by either Id or Index property. To allow data to be correctly restored from your data sources you should specify mapping either for the or for the . It makes sense in case if you bind to your data storages of Resources, Labels, Contacts or Categories. C1Schedule saves only Ids or Indexes of these objects in AppointmentSorage. If there is no mapping for IdMapping or IndexMapping, C1Schedule won't be able to identify Appointment's properties correctly in storages initialized by your data.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.MappingCollectionBase`1.IndexMapping
member.summary: Returns object for the property. If the storage object is bound to a data source via its DataSource property, the properties of this object allow the property to be bound to the appropriate field in the data source.
member.remarks: Each object derived from is identified by either Id or Index property. To allow data to be correctly restored from your data sources you should specify mapping either for the or for the . It makes sense in case if you bind to your data storages of Resources, Labels, Contacts or Categories. C1Schedule saves only Ids or Indexes of these objects in AppointmentSorage. If there is no mapping for IdMapping or IndexMapping, C1Schedule won't be able to identify Appointment's properties correctly in storages initialized by your data.

member.name: T:C1.C1Schedule.BaseStorage`2
member.summary: The is the base generic component for all storages in C1Schedule object model. Represents a storage of objects derived from . This component implements methods of operations over the collections of objects. It allows the collection to be populated programmatically or automatically by retrieving data from the data source which is specified by the DataSource and DataMember properties. It allows mapping of data source fields to the object properties.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.BasePersistableObject.Key
member.summary: Gets an array of objects representing the key of the .

remarks.para: In the current version, the array always contains a single object. It can be either an or value depending on which one is actually used for binding this data. For example, if you bind AppointmentStorage to the database and set IndexMapping, this property will return an value. If you set IdMapping, this property will return a value.
In future versions working with compound keys might be implemented. In such case this property will return array of objects composing the key.

member.name: M:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.BeginEdit
member.summary: Prevents the object from being updated until the method is called.
member.remarks: The and methods are designed to implement batch modifications. This allows you to prevent generation of change notifications when changing multiple settings at the same time. To do this enclose the code that changes the properties in calls to these methods. Each call to must be paired with a call to . To ensure that is always called even if an exception occurs, wrap any calls to these methods in a try...finally statement.

member.summary: Gets an object for the object. Once this property is first requested, a new object is created and assigned to the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Importance
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the relative importance level for the appointment. Default value is .

member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the current appointment is an All-day appointment.

member.summary: Gets or sets custom information associated with this object.
member.remarks: This property is valid only for the lifetime of the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.CustomData
member.summary: Gets or sets custom text associated with this object.
member.remarks: This property is serialized with other appointment properties. It isn't used by the scheduler, use it to keep your data associated with appointment. This property is serialized into xml and binary formats and it is saved into underlying data source if mapping for Appointment Properties is set. It isn't retained at export/import to iCal format.

member.summary: Gets the value indicating if the appointment has not been modified since the last save.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing the subject of the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing the body of the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Conflicts
member.summary: Gets the object representing the list of objects which are in conflict with this particular appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.AutoResolvedWinner
member.summary: Gets the value determining if the item is a winner of an automatic conflict resolution.
member.remarks: A value of false does not necessarily indicate that the item is a loser of an automatic conflict resolution. The item should be in conflict with another item. If an item has its Conflicts.Count property greater than zero and if its property is true, it is a winner of an automatic conflict resolution. On the other hand, if the item is in conflict and has its property as false, it is a loser in an automatic conflict resolution.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Start
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the start date and time of the appointment.

remarks.para: If the property is set to true, then the start date of the appointment is the of the , and the start time of the appointment is 0:00.
At setting this property, if it's time is not equal 0:00, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.End
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the end date and time of the appointment.

remarks.para: The property is usually specified by the and properties, and is always calculated as = + . When setting the property, the property retains its value, and the is changed according to the new value of the property. If the new property's value is less than the property's value, then an exception will be raised.
At setting this property, if it's time is not equal 0:00, or value is equal to the value of property, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.IsOneDay
member.summary: Gets a value indicating either it is a one day appointment or shares some days.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the duration of the appointment.
member.remarks: At setting this property, if it's value is not equal to the whole number of days, the property will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the value specifying where the appointment is going to be.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Reminder
member.summary: Gets the object which is associated with the appointment. To associate an appointment with the reminder, set its property to true. Once this property is set to true, a new object is created and assigned to the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether a reminder is associated with the appointment. Once this property is set to true, a new object is created and assigned to the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderTimeBeforeStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the interval of time the reminder should occur prior to the start of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderOverrideDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the associated object has non-default settings. True if the reminder overrides the default reminder behavior for the appointment. You must set the property to validate the and the properties.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderPlaySound
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the reminder should play a sound when it occurs for this appointment or task. The property must be set in order to validate the property. This property is only valid if the property is set to true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ReminderSoundFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the path and file name of the sound file to play when the reminder occurs for the appointment. This property is only valid if the and properties are set to true.
member.remarks: The default sound is the system Exclamation sound.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.IsRecurring
member.summary: Gets the value indicating if the appointment is recurring.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.ParentRecurrence
member.summary: Gets the object that defines the recurrence criteria for this object. If this appointment is a not member of a recurrence, or is itself a root appointment, null is returned.
member.remarks: If an appointment is recurring (see the property) it represents an occurrence in the series that is started and defined by a specific pattern appointment. Use the property to obtain the pattern of the current appointment. A pattern appointment can be recognized by its property set to the value. The recurrence information defined by the pattern appointment can be accessed via the property of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.RecurrenceState
member.summary: Gets the value indicating the recurrence state of the appointment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets the object associated with this appointment.
member.remarks: Labels may be associated with an appointment to effectively group appointments.
This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.LabelStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Resources
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the set of objects for this appointment. An appointment may be associated with multiple resources.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.ResourceStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Links
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the set of objects for this appointment. An appointment may be associated with multiple contacts.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.ContactStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.BusyStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the object indicating the busy status of the user for the appointment.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.StatusStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Categories
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the set of categories assigned to the appointment. Categories may be associated with an appointment to effectively group appointments. An appointment may be associated with multiple categories.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.CategoryStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.Appointment.Owner
member.summary: Gets or sets the object which owns current object.
member.remarks: This property only accepts objects which are present in the C1ScheduleStorage.OwnerStorage storage.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.CalendarInfo.DateTimeKind
member.summary: Gets or sets specifying DateTime kind used for saving values.
member.remarks: This property only have an influence on the process of saving data to the AppointmentStorage.DataSource object and on export operations. All properties of the and objects represent current system local time values. Set this property to DateTimeLind.Utc if you need to save data with universal time. In such case the data will be converted to the local time and back at every read/write operation.

member.summary: Gets the human-readable description of the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.RecurrenceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determining the type of recurrence (daily, monthly, etc.). Default value is RecurrenceTypeEnum.Weekly.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the value specifying the interval between occurrences of the recurrence. The property works in conjunction with the property to determine the cycle of the recurrence. The maximum allowable value is 99 for weekly patterns and 999 for daily patterns. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: For example, if the is set to , and the is set to 3, the recurrence will occur every third day.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.EndTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the end time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the start time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the duration of each occurrence in the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.PatternStartDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the start date of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.PatternEndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the end date of the recurrence pattern.
member.remarks: This property is optional but must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If this property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite, and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true. The property must be set before setting .

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Occurrences
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of occurrences for the recurrence pattern. This property allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the specified number of subsequent occurrences. For example, you can set this property to 10 for a formal training course that will be held on the next ten Thursday evenings. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: This property must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Instance
member.summary: Get or sets the value specifying the count for which the recurrence pattern is valid for a given interval. This property is only valid for recurrences of the and types and allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the Nth occurrence, such as "the 2nd Sunday in March" pattern. The default value is WeekOfMonthEnum.First.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.DayOfWeekMask
member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing the mask for week days on which the recurring appointment occurs. Monthly and yearly patterns are only valid for a single day. Weekly patterns are only valid as the Or of the . The default value is 0.
member.remarks: When the property is set to , the property can only be set to ; setting the property to any other value will result in an exception. When the property is set to , the property can only be set to ; setting the property to any other value will result in an exception. When the property is set to , the property cannot be set to ; doing so will result in an exception being thrown. When the property is set to or the property is not applicable.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.DayOfMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of the day in its respective month on which each occurrence will occur. Applicable only when the property is set to or . The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.MonthOfYear
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating which month of the year is valid for the specified recurrence pattern. Can be a number from 1 to 12. This property is only valid for recurrence patterns whose property is set to or . The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.NoEndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the recurrence pattern is endless. The default value is True.
member.remarks: This property must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the property is false. If neither nor is set, the pattern is considered infinite and is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.Exceptions
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the list of objects that define the exceptions to that series of appointments. objects are added to the whenever a property in the corresponding object is altered.

member.name: P:C1.C1Schedule.RecurrencePattern.RemovedOccurrences
member.summary: Gets the object which holds the list of objects removed from that series of appointments.

member.summary: Occurs when a object has been removed from the collection.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.Event.ParentRecurrenceId
member.summary: id of the event object that defines the recurrence criteria for this event object. If an event is recurring (see isRecurring) it represents an occurrence in the series that is started and defined by a specific pattern event. Use the getPatern method in order to obtain the pattern of the current event. A pattern event can be recognized by its recurrenceState field set to the "master" value. The recurrence information defined by the pattern event can be accessed via the recurrencePattern field of the event. If this event is a not member of a recurrence, or is itself a root event, this field will be null.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.Event.RecurrenceState
member.summary: Indicates the recurrence state of the event. (possible values are "notRecurring"(or null), "master", "occurrence", "exception", "removed")

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.Event.RecurrencePattern
member.summary: Represents the recurrence attributes of an event. Only master events can have this field (recurrenceState is "master")

member.summary: Id of the event object which represents the master event for this RecurrencePattern object.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.RecurrenceType
member.summary: Determines the type of recurrence: daily - the recurring event reoccurs on a daily basis. workdays - the recurring event reoccurs every working day. monthly - the recurring event reoccurs on a monthly basis. monthlyNth - the recurring event reoccurs every N months. weekly - the recurring event reoccurs on a weekly basis. yearly - the recurring event reoccurs on an yearly basis. yearlyNth - the recurring event reoccurs every N years.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.Interval
member.summary: Specifies the interval between occurrences of the recurrence. The interval field works in conjunction with the "recurrenceType" field to determine the cycle of the recurrence. The maximum allowable value is 99 for weekly patterns and 999 for daily patterns. The default value is 1. For example, if the recurrenceType is set to daily, and the "interval" is set to 3, the recurrence will occur every third day.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.StartTime
member.summary: Indicates the start time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.EndTime
member.summary: Indicates the end time for the given occurrence of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.PatternStartDate
member.summary: Indicates the start date of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.PatternEndDate
member.summary: Indicates the end date of the recurrence pattern.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.Occurrences
member.summary: The number of occurrences for the recurrence pattern. This field allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the specified number of subsequent occurrences. For example, you can set this property to 10 for a formal training course that will be held on the next ten Thursday evenings. The default value is 0. This field must be coordinated with other fields when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the "patternEndDate" field or the "occurrences" field is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the "noEndDate" field is false. If neither "patternEndDate" nor "occurrences" is set, the pattern is considered infinite and "noEndDate" is true.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.Instance
member.summary: Determines the week in a month in which the event will occur. This field is only valid for recurrences of the "monthlyNth" and "yearlyNth" types and allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the Nth occurrence, such as "the 2nd Sunday in March" pattern. The default value is "first". Possible values are: first - the recurring event will occur on the specified day or days of the first week in the month. second - The recurring event will occur on the specified day or days of the second week in the month. third = - The recurring event will occur on the specified day or days of the third week in the month. fourth - The recurring event will occur on the specified day or days of the fourth week in the month. last - The recurring event will occur on the specified day or days of the last week in the month.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.dayOfWeekMask
member.summary: String, contains set of values representing the mask for week days on which the recurring event occurs. Monthly and yearly patterns are only valid for a single day. The default value is "none". When the "RecurrenceType" field is set to "daily", the "DayOfWeekMask" field can only be set to "everyDay"; setting the field to any other value will result in an exception. When the "recurrenceType" field is set to "workdays", the "dayOfWeekMask" field can only be set to "workDays"; setting the field to any other value will result in an exception. When the "recurrenceType" field is set to "weekly", the "dayOfWeekMask" field cannot be set to "none"; doing so will result in an exception being thrown. When the recurrenceType" field is set to "monthly" or "yearly" the "dayOfWeekMask" field is not applicable. Possible values are: none - no specific value; the actual value is obtained from the root event object. sunday - specifies Sunday. monday - Specifies Monday. tuesday - Specifies Tuesday. wednesday - Specifies Wednesday. thursday - Specifies Thursday. friday - Specifies Friday. saturday - Specifies Saturday. weekendDays - Specifies Saturday and Sunday (or what ever days according to the settings of the C1EventsCalendar). workDays - Specifies work days (all days except weekend). everyDay - Specifies every day of the week.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.DayOfMonth
member.summary: The number of the day in its respective month on which each occurrence will occur. Applicable only when the recurrenceType field is set to "monthly" or "yearly". The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.MonthOfYear
member.summary: Number, indicates which month of the year is valid for the specified recurrence pattern. Can be a number from 1 to 12. This field is only valid for recurrence patterns whose recurrenceType" field is set to "yearlyNth" or "yearly". The default value is 1.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1EventsCalendar.RecurrencePattern.NoEndDate
member.summary: Indicates if the recurrence pattern is endless. The default value is True. This field must be coordinated with other fields when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the patternEndDate field or the occurrences field is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the "noEndDate" field is false. If neither patternEndDate nor occurrences is set, the pattern is considered infinite and "noEndDate" is true.

member.summary: Holds the list of event object's ids removed from that series of events.

member.summary: Cubic easing in. Begins at zero velocity and then accelerates.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Chart.ChartEasing.EaseOutCubic
member.summary: Cubic easing in and out. Begins at full velocity and then decelerates to zero.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Chart.ChartEasing.EaseInOutCubic
member.summary: Cubic easing in and out. Begins at zero velocity, accelerates until halfway, and then decelerates to zero velocity again.

member.summary: Back easing in. Starts slowly and then accelerates.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Chart.ChartEasing.EaseOutBack
member.summary: Back easing out. Begins quickly and then decelerates.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Chart.ChartEasing.EaseOutElastic
member.summary: Quintic easing out. Begins at full velocity and then decelerates to zero.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Chart.ChartEasing.EaseOutBounce
member.summary: Bouncing easing out. Begins quickly and then decelerates. The number of bounces is related to the duration: longer durations produce more bounces.

member.summary: Gets or sets the SelectedValue of .

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.SelectedIndex
member.summary: A value that specifies the index of the item to select when using single mode. If the selectionMode is "multiple", then this option could be set to an array of Number which contains the indices of the items to select. Default: -1. Type: Number/Array.
member.remarks: If no item is selected, it will return -1.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.LabelText
member.summary: A value that specifies the text in the wijcombobox label. Default: null. Type: String.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.MinLength
member.summary: A value that determines the minimum length of text that can be entered in the wijcombobox text box to issue an AJAX request. Default: 4. Type: Number.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.Delay
member.summary: A value that determines the duration (in milliseconds) of the time to delay before autocomplete begins after typing stops. Default: 300. Type: Number.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.ShowTrigger
member.summary: A value that determines whether to show the trigger of wijcombobox. Default: true. Type: Boolean.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.TriggerPosition
member.summary: A value that specifies the position of the drop-down list trigger. Default: "right". Type: String.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.DropdownHeight
member.summary: A value that specifies the height of the drop-down list. Default: 300. Type: Number.
member.remarks: If the total height of all items is less than the value of this option, it will use the total height of items as the height of the drop-down list.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.DropdownWidth
member.summary: A value that specifies the width of the drop-down list. Default: "-1". Type: Number.
member.remarks: When this option is set to "-1", the width of the drop-down list is equal to the width of wijcombobox.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.SelectOnItemFocus
member.summary: A value that determines whether to select the item when the item gains focus or is activated. Default: false. Type: Boolean.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.AutoFilter
member.summary: A value determines whether to shorten the drop-down list items by matching the text in the textbox after typing. Default: true. Type: Boolean.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.EnsureDropDownOnBody
member.summary: A value indicating the dropdown element will be append to the body or combobox container. If the value is true, the dropdown list will be appended to body element, else it will append to the combobox container. Default: true. Type: Boolean.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.AutoComplete
member.summary: A value that determines whether to start the auto-complete function after typing in the text if a match exists. Default: true. Type: Boolean.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.HighlightMatching
member.summary: A value that determines whether to highlight the keywords in an item. If "abc" is typed in the textbox, all "abc" matches are highlighted in the drop-down list. Default: true. Type: Boolean.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.DropDownListPosition
member.summary: A value that specifies the position options of the drop-down list

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.MultipleSelectionSeparator
member.summary: A value that specifies the separator for the multiple selected items text in the textbox. Default: ",". Type: String.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.ForceSelectionText
member.summary: A value that determines whether to check the input text against the text of the selected item when the focus blurs. Default: false. Type: Boolean.
member.remarks: If the text does not match any item, input text will restore to text the selected item or empty if no item is selected.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.IsEditable
member.summary: A value that determines whether input is editable. Default: true. Type: Boolean.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.SelectElementWidthFix
member.summary:
A value added to the width of the target select element to account for the scroll bar width of superpanel. Default: 6. Type: Number.
Unit for this value is pixel. Because the width of the scroll bar may be different between browsers if wijcombobox is initialized with the width of the HTML select element, the text may be hidden by the scroll bar of wijcombobox.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.ShowingAnimation
member.summary: A value that specifies the animation options for a drop-down list when it is visible. Default: null. Type: Object.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ComboBox.C1ComboBoxExtender.HidingAnimation
member.summary: A value specifies the animation options for the drop-down list when it is hidden. Default: null. Type: Object.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1FormDecorator.C1ButtonExtender.Label
P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1FormDecorator.C1ButtonExtender.Icons
member.summary: Icons to display, with or without text (see text option). The primary icon is displayed by default on the left of the label text, the secondary by default is on the right. Value for the primary and secondary properties must be a classname (String), eg. "ui-icon-gear". For using only one icon: icons: {primary:'ui-icon-locked'}. For using two icons: icons: {primary:'ui-icon-gear',secondary:'ui-icon-triangle-1-s'}

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Input.CharEx.ToFullWidth(System.Char)
member.summary: Transforms the specified character to a full-width character if possible. Ranges are Latin basic, Katakana and Hangul characters.
member.returns: Full width character of c, otherwise original character returned.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Input.CharEx.ToFullWidth(System.Boolean@,System.Char[])
member.summary: Transforms the specified character to a full-width character if possible.
member.param: true when the soundex character is processed; otherwise, false
member.returns: Full width character of c; otherwise the original character
member.remarks: This method differs from the other where it takes an array of characters. In Far East countries, there are times when multiple half-width characters make a one full-width character.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Input.CharEx.ToHalfWidth(System.Char)
member.summary: Converts the value of a Unicode character to its half-width equivalent. Ranges are Latin basic, Katakana, and Hangul characters.

returns.para: The half width equivalent of c
The unchanged value of c, if c is already a half width or not a multi-width character

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Input.CharEx.ToHalfWidthEx(System.Char)
member.summary: Transforms the specified character to a half-width character if possible.
member.returns: Character array representing c in half width form; in most cases this array will have only one element
member.remarks: This method differs from the ToHalfWidth method where it tries to return the accurate half-width character - which most likely happens in Far East countries.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Input.CharEx.ToKatakana(System.Char)
member.summary: Converts the value of a Unicode character to its "Katakana" equivalent. Special character handling for the Japanese language.

returns.para: The unchanged value of c, if c is already a Katakana or not Hiragana.

returns.para: The unchanged value of c, if c is already a Katakana or not Hiragana.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Input.CharEx.ToSJIS(System.Char)
member.summary: Converts the value of a JIS (Japanese encoding) character to its Shift-JIS equivalent.

returns.para: The unchanged value of c, if c is not a full width character.

remarks.newpara: Converts a JIS character to it's equivalent Shift-JIS character - used in the Japanese language.
Please note that this method does not take a Unicode character as it's parameter - use the character value returned by the "ToJIS" method.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Input.CharEx.ToJIS(System.Char)

Please note that this method does not take a Unicode character as it's parameter - use the character value returned by the "ToSJIS" method.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Input.C1InputTextExtender.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string that defines the type of text allowed for input in the control.
member.remarks: The following key words are supported. DBCS Keywords: Ａ Upper case DBCS alphabet (A-Z). ａ Lower case DBCS alphabet (a-z). Ｋ DBCS Katakana. ９ DBCS Numbers (0-9). ＃ DBCS numbers and number related symbols (0-9, +-$%\,.). ＠ DBCS symbols. Ｊ Hiragana. Ｚ All DBCS characters without Space. SBCS Keywords: A Upper case alphabet (A-Z). a Lower case alphabet (a-z). K Katakana. 9 Numbers (0-9). # Numbers and number related symbols (0-9, +-$%\,.). @ Symbols. H All SBCS characters without Space. ^ Any character not included in the specified format. \ Escape character. For example, format = 'Ａ', then the wijinputtext can only input the upper case DBCS alphabet. If you input the SBCS 'k', then it will be automatic conver to DBCS 'Ｋ' if the autoConvert is true, But if the autoConvert is false, you can't input 'k'.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1DataSource.C1DataSource.Reader
member.summary: The reader to use with wijdatasource. The wijdatasource class will call the read method of reader to read from rawdata with an array of fields provided. The field contains a name, mapping and defaultValue properties which define the rule of the mapping. If no reader is configured with wijdatasource it will directly return the raw data.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1DataSource.C1DataSource.Proxy
member.summary: The proxy to use with wijdatasource. The wijdatasource class will call the proxy object's request method. In the proxy object, you can send a request to a remote server to obtain data with the ajaxs options object provided. Then you can use the wijdatasource reader to process the raw data in the call.

member.summary: Determines if the widget can expand. Set this option to false if you want to disable collapse/expand ability.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Expander.C1ExpanderExtender.Animated
member.summary: Determines the animation easing effect; set this option to false in order to disable animation. Additional options that are available for the animation function include: expand - value of true indicates that content element must be expanded. horizontal - value of true indicates that expander is horizontally orientated (when expandDirection is left or right). content - jQuery object that contains content element to be expanded or collapsed.

members.member:
Array of dependencies.
In the array of dependencies each item can be one of the following:
- relative path to a resource. for .js path should be relative to C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.Resources.wijmo for .css path should be relative to C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.Resources.themes.wijmo Example: [WidgetDependencies("jquery.wijmo.wijcalendar.js"] [WidgetDependencies("jquery.wijmo.wijcalendar.css"]
- absolute path to a resource, in this case item should be prefixed with "@". Example: [WidgetDependencies("@C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.Resources.resource.js"]
- typeof(Extender) Example: [WidgetDependencies(typeof(CalendarExtender))]

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Grid.C1Field.DataParser
member.summary: Data converter that is able to translate values from a string representation to column data type and back.
member.remarks: The dataParser is an object which must contains the following methods: parseDOM(value, culture, format): converts given DOM element into the typed value. parse(value, culture, format): converts the value into typed value. toStr(value, culture, format): converts the value into its string representation.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Grid.C1Field.DataType

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Grid.C1Field.DataFormatString
member.summary: A pattern used for formatting and parsing column values.

remarks.para: The default value is undefined ("n" pattern will be used for "number" dataType, "d" for "datetime", "c" for "currency").
See globalize.min.js for possible values.

member.summary: A column will be generated for each data field and added to the end of the columns collection.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Grid.ColumnsAutogenerationMode.Merge
member.summary: Each column having dataKey option not specified will be automatically bound to the first unreserved data field. For each data field not bound to any column a new column will be generated and added to the end of the columns collection. To prevent automatic binding of a column to a data field set its dataKey option to null.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Grid.C1GridExtender.AllowEditing
member.summary: A value indicating whether editing is enabled. This property is obsolete. Use EditingMode instead.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Grid.C1GridExtender.AlwaysParseData
member.summary: Determines whether wijgrid should parse underlying data at each operation requiring data re-fetching, like calling the ensureControl(true) method, paging, sorting, etc. If the option is disabled, wijgrid parses data only at the first fetch. The option is ignored if dynamic data load feature is used, in this case data are always parsed.
member.remarks: Turning off the option enhance wijgrid perfomance but if underlying data are changed by a developer it is necessary that changes match column datatype.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Grid.C1GridExtender.ReadAttributesFromData
member.summary: A value indicating whether DOM cell attributes can be passed within a data values.

remarks.para: This option allows binding collection of values to data and automatically converting them as attributes of corresponded DOM table cells during rendering. Values should be passed as an array of two items, where first item is a value of the data field, the second item is a list of values.
If DOM table is used as a datasource then attributes belonging to the cells in tBody section of the original table will be read and applied to the new cells.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Grid.C1GridExtender.OnClientColumnDropped
member.summary: A function called when column has been dropped.
member.remarks:
Parameters:
e jQuery.Event object.
args
The data with this event.
drag Drag source, column being dragged.
drop Drop target, column on which drag source is dropped(be null if dropping a column into empty group area).
at Position to drop (one of the "left", "right" and "center" values) relative to drop target(be "left" if dropping a column into empty group area).

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Grid.C1GridExtender.OnClientColumnGrouped
member.summary: A function called when column has been dropped.
member.remarks:
Parameters:
e jQuery.Event object.
args
The data with this event.
drag Drag source, column being dragged.
drop Drop target, column on which drag source is dropped(be null if dropping a column into empty group area).
dragSource The place where the dragged column widget is located, possible value: "groupArea", "columns".
dropSource The place where the dropped column widget is located, possible value: "groupArea", "columns".
at Position to drop (one of the "left", "right" and "center" values) relative to drop target(be "left" if dropping a column into empty group area).

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Grid.C1GridExtender.OnClientColumnUngrouped
member.summary: A function called when column has been removed from the group area.

e jQuery.Event object.
args

column column being removed.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Grid.C1GridExtender.StaticColumnIndex
member.summary: Indicates the index of columns that will always be shown on the left when the grid view scrolled horizontally.
member.remarks: Note that all columns before the static column will be automatically marked as static too. It can only take effect when is not "None"/>. It will be considered as -1 when grouping or row merging is enabled. -1 means no data column but row header is static. 0 means one data column and row header are static.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Grid.C1GridExtender.StaticRowIndex
member.summary: Indicates the index of data rows that will always be shown on the top when the wijgrid is scrolled vertically.
member.remarks: Note, that all rows before the static row will be automatically marked as static too. It can only take effect when is not "None"/>. It will be considered as -1 when grouping or row merging is enabled. -1 means no data row but header row is static. 0 means one data row and header row are static.

member.summary: A function called after editing is completed.
member.remarks:
Parameters:
e jQuery.Event object.
args
The data with this event.
cell Gets the edited cell's information.
event Event that initiated the cell updating.
handled
Gets or sets value determining whether the developer finalizes editing of the cell manually. The default value is false which means that the widget will try to finalize editing of the cell automatically. If the developer provides a custom editing front end then this property must be set to true.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Input.C1InputDateExtender.DateFormat
member.summary: Determines the format pattern used to display the date value.
member.remarks:
C1InputDate supports two types of formats: Standard Format and Custom Format.
A standard date and time format string uses a single format specifier to define the text representation of a date and time value.
Possible values for Standard Format are: "d": ShortDatePattern "D": LongDatePattern "f": Full date and time (long date and short time) "F": FullDateTimePattern "g": General (short date and short time) "G": General (short date and long time) "m": MonthDayPattern "M": monthDayPattern "r": RFC1123Pattern "R": RFC1123Pattern "s": SortableDateTimePattern "t": shortTimePattern "T": LongTimePattern "u": UniversalSortableDateTimePattern "U": Full date and time (long date and long time) using universal time "y": YearMonthPattern "Y": yearMonthPattern
Any date and time format string that contains more than one character, including white space, is interpreted as a custom date and time format string. For example: "mmm-dd-yyyy", "mmmm d, yyyy", "mm/dd/yyyy", "d-mmm-yyyy", "ddd, mmmm dd, yyyy" etc.
Below are the custom date and time format specifiers:
"d": The day of the month, from 1 through 31. "dd": The day of the month, from 01 through 31. "ddd": The abbreviated name of the day of the week. "dddd": The full name of the day of the week. "m": The minute, from 0 through 59. "mm": The minute, from 00 through 59. "M": The month, from 1 through 12. "MM": The month, from 01 through 12. "MMM": The abbreviated name of the month. "MMMM": The full name of the month. "y": The year, from 0 to 99. "yy": The year, from 00 to 99 "yyy": The year, with a minimum of three digits. "yyyy": The year as a four-digit number "h": The hour, using a 12-hour clock from 1 to 12. "hh": The hour, using a 12-hour clock from 01 to 12. "H": The hour, using a 24-hour clock from 0 to 23. "HH": The hour, using a 24-hour clock from 00 to 23. "s": The second, from 0 through 59. "ss": The second, from 00 through 59. "t": The first character of the AM/PM designator. "tt": The AM/PM designator.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Input.C1InputDateExtender.StartYear
member.summary: Determines the value of the starting year to be used for the smart input year calculation.

member.summary: Allows smart input behavior.
member.remarks: When SmartInputMode is true, input control will automatically insert the closest century value when user types a number in year section.

member.summary: Determines the format pattern used to display the date value.
member.remarks:
C1InputDate supports two types of formats: Standard Format and Custom Format.
A standard date and time format string uses a single format specifier to define the text representation of a date and time value.
Possible values for Standard Format are: "d": ShortDatePattern "D": LongDatePattern "f": Full date and time (long date and short time) "F": FullDateTimePattern "g": General (short date and short time) "G": General (short date and long time) "m": MonthDayPattern "M": monthDayPattern "r": RFC1123Pattern "R": RFC1123Pattern "s": SortableDateTimePattern "t": shortTimePattern "T": LongTimePattern "u": UniversalSortableDateTimePattern "U": Full date and time (long date and long time) using universal time "y": YearMonthPattern "Y": yearMonthPattern
Any date and time format string that contains more than one character, including white space, is interpreted as a custom date and time format string. For example: "mmm-dd-yyyy", "mmmm d, yyyy", "mm/dd/yyyy", "d-mmm-yyyy", "ddd, mmmm dd, yyyy" etc.
Below are the custom date and time format specifiers:
"d": The day of the month, from 1 through 31. "dd": The day of the month, from 01 through 31. "ddd": The abbreviated name of the day of the week. "dddd": The full name of the day of the week. "m": The minute, from 0 through 59. "mm": The minute, from 00 through 59. "M": The month, from 1 through 12. "MM": The month, from 01 through 12. "MMM": The abbreviated name of the month. "MMMM": The full name of the month. "y": The year, from 0 to 99. "yy": The year, from 00 to 99 "yyy": The year, with a minimum of three digits. "yyyy": The year as a four-digit number "h": The hour, using a 12-hour clock from 1 to 12. "hh": The hour, using a 12-hour clock from 01 to 12. "H": The hour, using a 24-hour clock from 0 to 23. "HH": The hour, using a 24-hour clock from 00 to 23. "s": The second, from 0 through 59. "ss": The second, from 00 through 59. "t": The first character of the AM/PM designator. "tt": The AM/PM designator.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Input.C1InputDateExtender.Hour12As0
member.summary: Gets or sets the range of hours that can be entered in the control.
member.value: One of the bool enumeration values. The default is false

remarks.para: This proprety determines the range of hours that can be entered or displayed when the format expression specified by the or the properties describe 12-hour format -- the "tt" and the "HH" keywords included.
If set this property to false, the control sets the range for the hour field from 1 - 12. If set to true the range is set to 0 - 11.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Input.C1InputDateExtender.MidnightAs0
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to express midnight as 24:00.
member.value: false if expressed as 24 o'clock (24:00:00); otherwise, true expressed as 0 o'clock (00:00:00). The default is true.

remarks.para: The MidnightAs24 property effects the property when the property is set to the 24-hour format ("HH:mm:ss").

member.summary: Gets or sets the label's alignment on the progress bar. Possible values are: East The label is aligned on the right side of the progress bar. West The label is aligned on the left side of the progress bar. Center The label is aligned in the center of the progress bar. North The label is aligned at the top of the progress bar. South The label is aligned at the bottom of the progress bar. Running The label is aligned with the edge of the progress bar.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the progress bar.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ProgressBar.C1ProgressBarExtender.FillDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction from which the progress bar will start to fill. Possible options include: East (right-to-left), West (left-to-right), North (top-to-bottom), or South (bottom-to-top).

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1ProgressBar.C1ProgressBarExtender.LabelFormatString
member.summary: The remarks need to be spaced with paragraph marks. They are currently running together: The available formats are as follows: {0} or {ProgressValue} Expresses the current progress value. {1} or {PercentProgress} Expresses the current percent of the progress bar. {2} or {RemainingProgress} Expresses the remaining progress of the progress bar. {3} or {PercentageRemaining} Expresses the remaining percent of the progress bar. {4} or {Min} Expresses the minimum value of the progress bar. {5} or {Max} Expresses the maximum value of the progress bar.

member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the image for the progress indicator.

member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the tooltip for the progress bar. The available formats are as follows: {0} or {ProgressValue} Expresses the current progress value. {1} or {PercentProgress} Expresses the current percent of the progress bar. {2} or {RemainingProgress} Expresses the remaining progress of the progress bar. {3} or {PercentageRemaining} Expresses the remaining percent of the progress bar. {4} or {Min} Expresses the minimum value of the progress bar. {5} or {Max} Expresses the maximum value of the progress bar.

member.summary: A value indicates the size or amount of each interval or step the slider takes between min and max. The full specified value range of the slider (max - min) needs to be evenly divisible by the step.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Slider.C1SliderExtender.Range
member.summary: If the option value set to true, the slider will detect if you have two handles and create a styleable range element between these two. Two other possible values are 'min' and 'max'. A min range goes from the slider min to one handle. A max range goes from one handle to the slider max.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Slider.C1SliderExtender.Value
member.summary: A value indicates the value of the slider, if there's only one handle. If there is more than one handle, determines the value of the first handle.

member.summary: This option can be used to specify multiple handles. If range is set to true, the length of 'values' should be 2.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Wijmo.Extenders.C1Slider.C1SliderExtender.Orientation
member.summary: A value indicates whether the slider has the min at the left, the max at the right or the min at the bottom, the max at the top. Possible values: 'horizontal', 'vertical'.
